#Text=Create an Apple ID for Children
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to set up Family Sharing in your iCloud Settings , and how to use Family Sharing to create an Apple ID for a child .
#Text=Steps
#Text=iPhone or iPad
#Text=Open your iOS device ’s settings .
#Text=Do this by tapping the gear icon on one of the device ’s home screens .
#Text=You may see it inside of a folder called Utilities .
#Text=Scroll down and tap .
#Text=You may have to scroll down a few times to find it .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=When you set up Family Sharing , you become the family “ organizer , ” which means you can add a child account for which you ’ll have full administrative control .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=Tap to use
#Text=confirm that you want to be the organizer for this family .
#Text=If you see a different account listed than your own , click the link at the bottom that says “ Not [ xxx ] or want to use a different ID ? ” and then sign in .
#Text=Tap to make your iTunes and App Store purchases available to the family .
#Text=Now you wo n’t have to pay for the same app twice if you want it on multiple family members ’ devices .
#Text=Enter your credit card information .
#Text=This is required to prove that you ’re an adult .
#Text=If you ’ve already entered your credit card information , tap to confirm that you want to use the card on file .
#Text=Tap .
#Text=This allows other members of your family to see your whereabouts in Find My Friends .
#Text=When finished , you ’ll return to the Family screen .
#Text=If you do n’t want to share your location , tap .
#Text=Tap the blue link .
#Text=You may have to scroll down to locate it .
#Text=Enter the child ’s birth date and tap .
#Text=Tap to accept the Parental Disclosure .
#Text=Verify your credit card information and tap .
#Text=Enter your child ’s name and tap .
#Text=Enter an Apple ID for your child and tap .
#Text=This is the name your child will use to sign in to Apple devices and services .
#Text=Follow the on-screen instructions to set up a new password and security questions .
#Text=Make sure “ Ask to Buy ” is on and tap .
#Text=When enabled , iTunes or App Store purchases your child attempts to make will require your permission .
#Text=Tap so your child ’s location appears in Find My Friends .
#Text=Only family members will see your child ’s location .
#Text=If you do n’t want to enable location sharing for your child , tap instead .
#Text=Tap to accept the Terms and Conditions .
#Text=Once this step is complete , your child ’s account is ready to use .
#Text=Your child can now sign in to any Apple device or service with their new Apple ID .
#Text=Mac
#Text=Click the Apple menu .
#Text=It ’s the black apple-shaped icon on the far left of the menu bar at the top of the screen .
#Text=Click .
#Text=Click .
#Text=If you do n’t see this option , click the button that looks like three rows of dots at the top of the screen , or .
#Text=Click .
#Text=It ’s on the left sign of the screen , beneath your name and photo .
#Text=When you set up Family Sharing , you become the family “ organizer , ” which means you can add a child account for which you ’ll have full administrative control .
#Text=If you ’ve already set up Family Sharing , you ’ll see instead .
#Text=Click this and then skip to step 11 .
#Text=Read the description of Family Sharing and click .
#Text=Click to confirm that you want to be the organizer for the family .
#Text=The Family organizer is able to add people to the family , including child accounts .
#Text=Click to confirm that your iTunes and App Store purchases will be available on your family ’s devices .
#Text=Enter your credit card information and click .
#Text=This is required to add an Apple ID for a child , though your card will not be charged .
#Text=If you already have a credit card associated with your account , it should appear here with only the last 4 digits visible .
#Text=Choose whether or not to share your location with other members of your family .
#Text=If you choose “ Share your location , ” other members of your family will be able to see you in “ Find My Friends . ”
#Text=Click .
#Text=Now you ’ll return to the Family Sharing screen .
#Text=Click or .
#Text=The appearance of the button may vary depending on your version of macOS .
#Text=Click .
#Text=Enter your child ’s information into the “ Enter the child ’s information ” screen .
#Text=Choose your child ’s birthday from the dropdown menus .
#Text=Type a new Apple ID ( the username they ’ll use to log into Apple products and services ) for your child .
#Text=Enter and verify a new password .
#Text=Place a check next to “ Share your child ’s location with your family ” so that you can find your child under Find my Friends .
#Text=Click .
#Text=Follow the prompts to complete the account setup .
#Text=You ’ll create security questions , confirm your credit card , and accept the Apple ID agreement .
#Text=When the setup is complete , you ’ll return to the Family Sharing screen .
#Text=Click your child ’s account on the left side of Family Sharing .
#Text=Make sure “ Ask to Buy ” is checked .
#Text=This makes it so every purchase your child attempts to make from iTunes or the App Store will prompt you to give permission .
#Text=Click .
#Text=Your child can now sign in to any Apple service or product using their new username and password .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Your email address becomes the rescue address for your child ’s account .
#Text=If your child loses their password , the recovery email will be sent to you .
#Text=Your child must stay a member of the Family account until they are 13 .
